Detailed Description

This namespace contains useful functions for parsing strings. Such functions are used mainly by the abstract factory that creates random variables.

Function Documentation

string get_param ( const string &  instr,
const string &  open_par = "(",
const string &  close_par = ")" 
)

Given an instruction instr of the form "token(p1,p2)" returns the parameters "p1,p2".

string parse_util::get_param2 ( const string &  instr,
const string &  open_par = "=" 
)

Given an instruction instr of the form "token = param1, param2" returns the parameters "param1, param2" (i.e. it returns everything after the separation symbol)

const string &  open_par = "("

double &  res,
string &  unit 
)

Given a string of the form "123.75ms" returns the double number at the beginning of the string in res and the unit of measure in unit.

string remove_spaces ( const string &  tk)

Definition at line 9 of file strtoken.cpp.

vector< string > split ( const string &  code,
const string &  sep 
)

Given a string code, consisting of many substrings separated by the sequence sep, returns a vector containing the substrings. For example, given the string "fixed(1);wait(R);" returns the vector containing strings "fixed(1)" and "wait(R)".

Definition at line 22 of file strtoken.cpp.

vector< string > split_instr ( const string &  code)

Given a sequence of "instructions" spearated by ';', returns a vector containing the istructions. Notice that the last instructions must finish with a ';', otherwise it is ignored.
